docs.snippet: Steve Kerr agreed to a deal to coach the Golden State Warriors, leaving Phil Jackson and the Knicks to turn to Plan B in their coaching search....
docs.lead_paragraph: Steve Kerr agreed to a deal to coach the Golden State Warriors, leaving Phil Jackson and the Knicks to turn to Plan B in their coaching search.
docs.abstract: Steve Kerr reaches deal with Golden State Warriors to become their head coach, stunning the New York Knicks, whose president Phil Jackson was chasing Kerr to fill coaching vacancy left by Mike Woodson; Warriors are a more talented team than the Knicks and Kerr lives in California, both likely contributing factors to his decision.

headline.main: Steve Kerr Will Coach Warriors, Spurning the Knicks
headline.print_headline: Spurning Knicks, Kerr Reaches Deal to Coach Warriors

docs.snippet: Joe Johnson scored 34 points, but he lost the ball on the Nets’ final possession as the Heat eliminated their high-priced opponents and returned to the conference finals....
docs.lead_paragraph: Joe Johnson scored 34 points, but he lost the ball on the Nets’ final possession as the Heat eliminated their high-priced opponents and returned to the conference finals.
docs.abstract: Miami Heat defeats Brooklyn Nets, 96-94, to win Eastern Conference semifinal series, 4-1.

docs.snippet: The Los Angeles Clippers have gone through a tumultuous several weeks. Now, they will have to gather themselves again, this time after a devastating loss to Oklahoma City....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Los Angeles Clippers have gone through a tumultuous several weeks. Now, they will have to gather themselves again, this time after a devastating loss to Oklahoma City.
docs.abstract: Los Angeles Clippers, having gone through a tumultuous several weeks since recordings of racist remarks by owner Donald Sterling emerged, will return home trailing 3-2 in Western Conference semifinal series against Oklahoma City Thunder.

headline.main: The Clippers Lament Miscues and Bemoan a Costly Call
headline.print_headline: The Clippers Lament Miscues and Bemoan a Costly Call

docs.snippet: An antitrust lawsuit against the NCAA took a new twist when former UCLA basketball star Ed O'Bannon and 19 other former athletes gave up their claim to individual monetary damages, just weeks before the case is scheduled to go to trial....
docs.lead_paragraph: An antitrust lawsuit against the NCAA took a new twist when former UCLA basketball star Ed O'Bannon and 19 other former athletes gave up their claim to individual monetary damages, just weeks before the case is scheduled to go to trial.

headline.main: Lawsuit Against NCAA Takes New Twist on Damages
headline.print_headline: Lawsuit Against NCAA Takes New Twist on Damages

docs.snippet: The National Basketball Association (NBA)'s board of governors has unanimously approved the $550 million sale of the Milwaukee Bucks to hedge fund managers Wesley Edens and Marc Lasry, the league announced on Thursday....
docs.lead_paragraph: The National Basketball Association (NBA)'s board of governors has unanimously approved the $550 million sale of the Milwaukee Bucks to hedge fund managers Wesley Edens and Marc Lasry, the league announced on Thursday.

headline.main: League Approves Sale of Milwaukee Bucks
headline.print_headline: League Approves Sale of Milwaukee Bucks

docs.snippet: Los Angeles Clippers head coach Doc Rivers has been fined $25,000 by the National Basketball Association for public criticism of officiating, the league said on Thursday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Los Angeles Clippers head coach Doc Rivers has been fined $25,000 by the National Basketball Association for public criticism of officiating, the league said on Thursday.

headline.main: Clippers' Rivers Fined $25,000 for Criticizing Officials
headline.print_headline: Clippers' Rivers Fined $25,000 for Criticizing Officials

docs.snippet: Criminals are using betting on sports events to launder $140 billion each year, a report said on Thursday, exposing a lack of effective regulation that allows match-fixing to spread....

headline.main: Crime Gangs Launder $140 Billion Through Sports Betting-Report
headline.print_headline: Crime Gangs Launder $140 Billion Through Sports Betting-Report

docs.snippet: Hong Kong is set to begin destroying nearly 30 tons of confiscated ivory, in a move that activists say will send a powerful message about the government’s resolve to end a trade that has contributed to widespread poaching of elephants....
docs.abstract: Hong Kong is set to begin destroying nearly 30 tons of confiscated ivory, in a move that activists say will send a powerful message about the government’s resolve to end a trade that has contributed to widespread poaching of elephants.

headline.main: Activists Praise Hong Kong's Destruction of Confiscated Ivory

docs.snippet: Nearly half a century since its creation, the tennis, table tennis and badminton hybrid is growing in popularity among baby boomers....
docs.lead_paragraph: Nearly half a century since its creation, the tennis, table tennis and badminton hybrid is growing in popularity among baby boomers.
docs.abstract: Pickleball, hybrid of racket and paddle sports, is growing in popularity among retired baby boomers; USA Pickleball Assn counts 150,000 active players now, almost triple the number in 2010.

headline.main: A Funny Name, a Serious Sport. Pickleball, Anyone?
headline.print_headline: A Funny Name, a Serious Sport. Pickleball, Anyone?
